title: 'We look at firefighters as heroes... but we just wanted them to do their job'
text:
Nazanin Aghlani hadn’t wanted a superhero to save her mother. A professional firefighter just doing their job should have been enough. Instead more than two years on from the Grenfell disaster she found herself still grieving for the mother and the aunt who perished in the blaze.

Ms Aghlani wasn’t alone in wondering why her loved ones hadn’t survived. At a hastily arranged press conference, held a stone’s throw from the palace of Westminster, the relatives of the deceased called, one after the other, for the prosecution for manslaughter of the senior fire brigade bosses who they said had failed on the night of the tragedy.
